intro: Icacorea bekomiensis, commonly known as the Bekomi coral tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble coral-like clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
